sentences.english: Jack swallowed hard as he watched the black Mercedes speed away.
sentences.chinese: 傑克艱難地嚥下一口唾沫，看着黑色奔馳車絕塵而去。

sentences.english: But is it even possible not to spit during a match?
sentences.chinese: 但是，在比賽中間一口唾沫都不吐，這可能麼？

sentences.english: In addition to vomit your face emerge spittle, you Mandehuaya play.
sentences.chinese: 除了吐你們滿臉滿身唾沫，還打得你們滿地找牙。

sentences.english: She spit out a little saliva on a cloth to wipe the mirror clean.
sentences.chinese: 她在布上吐了一點唾沫來擦淨鏡子。

sentences.english: And they smote him on the head with a reed, and did spit upon him, and bowing their knees worshipped him.
sentences.chinese: 又拿一根葦子，打他的頭，吐唾沫在他臉上屈膝拜他。

sentences.english: The on-lookers all spat on the thief.
sentences.chinese: 圍觀者們齊向這個小偷身上吐唾沫。

sentences.english: I'm on the top of the world, don't even tryna spit me.
sentences.chinese: 我踩着世界之巔，別試圖衝我吐唾沫。

sentences.english: He spat in the man's face.

sentences.chinese: 說話的時候，別把唾沫星子噴出來。

sentences.english: I swallowed hard, a taste of bile invading my senses.
sentences.chinese: 我艱難地吞嚥了一口唾沫，我嚐到一種膽汁的味道。

sentences.english: I take out my artificial eye, spit on it and polish it with my handkerchief.
sentences.chinese: 我取下假眼，朝上面啐口唾沫，用手帕擦拭了一番。

sentences.english: He spluttered and excitedly talked about something.
sentences.chinese: 他唾沫星子亂飛，激動地在說着什麼。

sentences.english: If someone was throwing spitballs I could guess the culprit's name.
sentences.chinese: 如果有人扔唾沫紙團，我能猜出罪魁禍首的名字。

sentences.english: His mouth froths , and the froth is the word.
sentences.chinese: 他正滿嘴唾沫，那唾沫便是那個字了。

sentences.english: His mouth froths , and the froth is the word.
sentences.chinese: 他正滿嘴唾沫，那唾沫便是那個字了。

definition: to spit/fig. to spit out (a request, an agreement etc)
to sip/to smack one's lips/to taste/to savor
to open one's mouth (to speak, esp. to make a request)/to gape
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
